meanings.definition: of or relating to a tomb or burial
meanings.sent1: The ancient cemetery had a sepulchral atmosphere, with moss-covered gravestones.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered at the sepulchral site to pay their respects to the departed.
meanings.sent3: The ghost tour guide joked about the sepulchral silence scaring away noisy spirits.
meanings.sent4: The sepulchral crypt seemed to whisper secrets of the past to those who dared to enter.
meanings.sent5: The sepulchral darkness of the tomb sent shivers down the visitors' spines.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had a sepulchral appearance, with boarded-up windows.
meanings.sent2: The news of the failed mission cast a sepulchral shadow over the team.
meanings.sent3: Despite the sepulchral weather, the children found joy in jumping in puddles.
meanings.sent4: Her sepulchral mood lifted when she received a surprise visit from an old friend.
meanings.sent5: The sepulchral clouds hung low in the sky, foretelling a stormy evening.

meanings.sent1: The library was so sepulchral that even the sound of a pin dropping would echo.
meanings.sent2: The sepulchral forest was devoid of any signs of wildlife, creating an eerie silence.
meanings.sent3: The sepulchral hush of the classroom made the students feel like they were in a museum.
meanings.sent4: In the sepulchral night, the only sound was the distant howl of a lone wolf.
meanings.sent5: The sepulchral calm of the lake mirrored the tranquility of the early morning.
